net.canarymod.permissionsystem

Class PermissionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.permissionsystem.PermissionNode

  • public class PermissionNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A permission node. This represents a permission. Who would have thought
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

      • getId

        public int getId()

        Returns:

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Set the database ID for this Node. Do not use this unless you're dead sure what you're doing! it is HIGHLY unlikely that you will need this
        Parameters:
        id - the id to set

      • setParentNode

        public void setParentNode(PermissionNode parent)
        Sets the parent node.
        Parameters:
        parent - the new parent

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Get the value of this node
        Returns:
        the value of this node where true means "granted" false means "denied"

      • setValue

        public void setValue(boolean value)
        Override the initially given value for this node
        Parameters:
        value - the value for this node

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this node
        Returns:
        the name

      • getFullPath

        public java.lang.String getFullPath()
        Returns the full path name for this node starting here, upwards to the first node in the inheritance tree
        Returns:
        a string representing the path up to this node

      • parentsToList

        private java.util.List<PermissionNode> parentsToList()
        This creates a list of parents starting with this nodes parent, walking the tree upwards to the first, resulting in a reverse parent list. For example if this node was canary.world.canEnter, the list would be ordered like this: canEnter,world,canary
        Returns:
        list of parents

      • walkParents

        private void walkParents(java.util.List<PermissionNode> list,
                         PermissionNode node)

        Get a child node of this node with the given name
        Parameters:
        child - name of the child node
        Returns:
        an instance of the child node. Might be null if the specified child does not exist

      • isWildcard

        public boolean isWildcard()
        Check if this is an asterisk permission, granting access to all subsequent nodes
        Returns:
        true if this is a wildcard node, false otherwise

      • fromString

        public static PermissionNode fromString(java.lang.String in)
        Returns a permission node from a well formatted string.
        The String should be node.path:value
        Where value should be true or false. Value is an optional field. It will default to true
        Parameters:
        in -
        Returns:

      • addPath

        public void addPath(java.lang.String[] path,
                    boolean value,
                    int index)

      • resolveToValue

        public boolean resolveToValue(java.lang.String[] path,
                              int index)
        Resolves a given path of permission names into the resulting value. This resolves the permission
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        index - the current index in the string array
        Returns:
        true if permission on this path is granted, false otherwise

      • resolvePath

        public boolean resolvePath(java.lang.String[] path,
                           int index)
        Purely resolves a path. This can be used to see if any given permission path can be fully resolved. Wildcards are taken into account
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        index - the current index in the string array
        Returns:
        true if path can be resolved, false otherwise
